name: Project Dashboard Design Concept
description: High-level design concept document for the Project Dashboard application. This document captures the design philosophy, principles, and guidelines that define the visual identity and user experience of the application.

designPhilosophy.summary: A modern, clean SaaS application design that prioritizes clarity, functionality, and professional aesthetics. The design balances minimalism with warmth through subtle shadows, generous spacing, and a restrained color palette.
coreValues: Clarity over decoration - every element serves a purpose
Accessibility as a foundation, not an afterthought
Responsive and adaptive to all screen sizes

hierarchy.description: Visual hierarchy is established through size, weight, and color contrast rather than excessive decoration
guidelines: Use typography scale for information hierarchy (text-xs through text-2xl)
Semibold (600) for headings, medium (500) for interactive elements, regular (400) for body text
Muted foreground colors for secondary information
Primary color sparingly for key actions and active states

whitespace.description: Generous whitespace creates breathing room and improves scanability
guidelines: Card padding of 24px (p-6) creates comfortable content areas
Consistent gaps between elements (8px, 12px, 16px)
Section spacing of 20-24px for visual grouping
Header areas with 16px padding for balanced proportions

feedback.description: Every interaction provides clear visual feedback
guidelines: Focus states with 3px ring and reduced opacity ring color
Hover states with subtle background changes (accent color)
Active/selected states with primary color indicators
Disabled states at 50% opacity with no pointer events
Transitions at 200ms for smooth state changes

consistency.description: Systematic use of design tokens ensures visual cohesion
guidelines: All colors defined as CSS custom properties
Border radius scale based on 12px base (--radius: 0.75rem)
Consistent icon sizing (h-3 w-3, h-4 w-4, h-5 w-5)
Standardized component heights (h-8, h-9, h-10)

visualStyle.overall: Clean, minimal SaaS aesthetic with subtle depth through shadows and borders
characteristics: Flat design with subtle shadow layers for depth
Thin 1px borders in muted gray tones
Neutral gray palette with blue accent color

colorPhilosophy.approach: OKLCH color space for perceptually uniform colors with semantic naming

primary.description: Deep blue used for primary actions, active states, and focus indicators
primary.darkMode: oklch(0.56 0.19 254.5) - Lighter blue for dark backgrounds
primary.usage: Buttons, links, active tabs, focus rings, progress indicators

neutrals.description: Grayscale palette for backgrounds, borders, and text
neutrals.usage: Background layers, borders, muted text, cards

semantic.destructive: Red-orange for errors and destructive actions (oklch(0.577 0.245 27.325))
semantic.success: Teal for completion states (teal-600 on checkboxes)

dataVisualization.description: Five-color chart palette for data visualization

darkMode.approach: Invert lightness values while maintaining hue relationships
darkMode.adjustments: Increased saturation on accent colors for visibility

fontFamily.primary: Geist - Modern geometric sans-serif optimized for interfaces
fontFamily.monospace: Geist Mono - For code and technical content

scale.approach: Semantic sizing with Tailwind's default scale

typographyPhilosophy.rendering: antialiased class on body for smooth text rendering

guidelines: Cards and major containers use lg (12px)
Buttons and inputs use xl (rounded-xl) or md
Badges use full (rounded-full) for pill shape
Nested elements use smaller radius than parent

shadowPhilosophy.approach: Minimal shadows for subtle depth, avoiding heavy drop shadows

levels.xs: shadow-xs - Subtle lift for inputs, outline buttons

special.workstream: Custom inset shadow for workstream containers

principles: Subtle and purposeful - animations enhance, never distract
Consistent easing - ease-out for entrances, ease-in for exits

layoutPhilosophy.structure: Sidebar-plus-content layout for desktop, drawer navigation for mobile

content.pattern: Full-width content area with internal max-width constraints
content.tabs: Horizontal tab navigation with bottom border indicator
content.cards: Grid layouts for dashboards, lists for detail views

libraries: Phosphor Icons (primary) - Consistent line weight and style
Lucide Icons (secondary) - Used in shadcn/ui components

buttons.philosophy: Clear hierarchy with distinct visual treatments per variant
variants: default (primary): Solid blue background, white text - primary actions
outline: Border only with subtle background - secondary actions
secondary: Muted gray background - tertiary actions
ghost: Transparent until hovered - inline/contextual actions
link: Text only with underline on hover - navigation

forms.philosophy: Clean, accessible inputs with clear state indicators
patterns: Clear focus states with ring indicator
Labels positioned above inputs for clarity

cards.philosophy: Content containers with consistent padding and subtle borders

navigation.philosophy: Clear wayfinding with visible active states
patterns: Bottom border indicator for active tabs
Background highlight for active menu items
Consistent item height (h-9) in navigation menus
Icon + text pattern for navigation items
Tables with subtle row borders and hover states
Badges for status and category indicators

color.contrast: WCAG AA compliant text contrast ratios
color.notOnlyColor: Status indicated by icons and text, not just color

interaction.feedback: Clear visual feedback for all interactions

themeSupport.implementation: CSS custom properties swapped via .dark class
themeSupport.persistence: System preference respected, user choice persisted

instructionsForAI.summary: When building new components or pages in this application, follow these guidelines to maintain visual consistency:
keyRules: Always use CSS custom properties (var(--color-name)) for colors, never hardcode hex/rgb values
Use the established spacing scale (space-1 through space-6) for consistent rhythm
Apply the border radius scale appropriately - larger containers get larger radius
Include proper focus states using the standard ring pattern
Maintain consistent component heights (h-8, h-9, h-10) for alignment
Use Geist font family with appropriate weights for typography hierarchy
Provide hover and active states for all interactive elements
Support both light and dark modes through CSS variables
Use Phosphor Icons as the primary icon library with consistent sizing
Prioritize clarity and functionality over decoration
Test at 768px breakpoint for responsive behavior
avoidances: Avoid heavy drop shadows - use subtle shadows sparingly
Avoid decorative gradients - maintain flat aesthetic
Avoid inconsistent border radii - follow the scale
Avoid custom colors outside the defined palette
Avoid fixed widths that break responsiveness
